result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald Michael Trepania Jr.

records.addlTxt:
3:30 PM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania Jr. appeared by video from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Donald Michael Trepania Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Forseth indicates offer has been received and relayed to DEF.  Attny Forseth request bond modification hearing and status.   State makes statement regarding bond modification request.   Attny Forseth to file bond motion, and hearing will be set.   Court sets status hearing.  Bond Continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:12 PM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Donald Michael Trepania Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Forseth acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.
Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:54 AM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Atty Forseth indicates DEF  waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.

Attny Forseth request bond modification.  Attny Gross objects to bond request.  Court denies bond motion.  Bond Continues.  
Arraignment scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:42 AM Defendant Donald Michael Trepania Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert N Forseth appeared by video for Donald Michael Trepania Jr.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Court enters NG Plea to Count 3.  Bond Continues.  Attny Forseth request preliminary hearing to be set.  Court sets.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:22 AM Defendant Donald Trepania in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Alysja Otten (special appearance) appear in court.  Kenneth  Sortedahl appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court. DE does qualify for PD appointment, conflict with local office.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Otten argues bond.   Court sets bond.
